P096285.project_name: Micro and Small Enterprise Finance Project

keywords.cdata: accountability, actual cost, ADB, bank lending, bank loans, Bank management, Bank supervision, banking sector, banking system, Banks, benchmarks, borrowing, capacity building, capital adequacy, commercial banks, credit cooperatives, credit culture, credit guarantees, credit risk, debt, debt capacity, default risk, deposits, deregulation, development policies, early warning system, economic growth, employment, financial institutions, financial intermediaries, financial intermediation, financial liberalization, Financial Management, financial policies, financial sector, financial sector reform, financial services, GDP, GNP, Gross Domestic Product, guidelines, income levels, interest rate, interest rates, liability management, microfinance, natural resources, onlending, Operating Costs, Pacific Region, portfolio, portfolio quality, portfolios, private investors, profit margin, profitability, Project Financing, real interest rate, resource allocation, return on equity, risk exposure, Savings, small business, Statement, statements, Subsidiary, supervisory framework, Technical Assistance, transition economies, working capital

project_abstract.cdata: The China Micro and Small Enterprise Finance Project will support the Government's priority program to catalyze the expansion of commercial lending to the emerging segment of medium-sized enterprises (MSEs) that are strongly competitive and privately owned, but in need of funds for working and investment capital. The project also aims to strengthen the capacity of banks to provide lending to MSEs on a mass-market and profitable basis.  The project consists of two closely linked components: (i) a Credit Facility for on-lending to eligible units; and (ii) a Technical Assistance Facility to support capacity building.

P096285.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>微小企业贷款项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>项目目标是在大众市场和商业可持续性的基础上扩大针对微小企业的贷款，目的帮助国家开发银行开发一项新的业务，向参与项目的地方合作银行批发微小企业补贴贷款和提供相关的技术支持。项目包括批发和零售两个层面。国家开发银行被选为项目的批发银行，将为参与项目的零售层面的地方合作银行提供贷款和技术支持。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
